snippet.textDisplay:
TL;DR: Your channel is awesome, needs more Genesis music, check out the Thunder Force III and IV soundtracks.

Okay Supra, let's get real here. You SERIOUSLY need some more Genesis tracks on your channel. People bash it for having "poor quality" and "terrible instrumentation" but just trust me when I say that there are some things that only the Genesis could pull off, namely techno, like the Streets of Rage series, and more gritty, hardcore metal tracks like Thunder Force IV. And speaking of Thunder Force, by far some of the best music soundtracks on the system. Thunder Force III and IV kick some serious 16-bit tail. If you haven't heard either of those soundtracks DO SO RIGHT NOW!! And please, I implore you, ADD MORE GENESIS MUSIC TO YOUR CHANNEL!!
snippet.textOriginal:
TL;DR: Your channel is awesome, needs more Genesis music, check out the Thunder Force III and IV soundtracks.

snippet.textDisplay: @Joey Ford Believe me I'm no stranger to what the Genesis is capable of. Those soundtracks are incredible, btw. I just hope Supra actually READS these comments and takes Thunder Force III and IV into consideration.
snippet.textOriginal: @Joey Ford Believe me I'm no stranger to what the Genesis is capable of. Those soundtracks are incredible, btw. I just hope Supra actually READS these comments and takes Thunder Force III and IV into consideration.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Moop Bread
I requested him to put at least one theme from Devilish (Composed by Hitoshi Sakimoto).
I also think he should at least put at least one theme from Gauntlet IV (Again, composed by Hitoshi Sakimoto, but with Masaharu Iwata)

And let me tell you, those games soundtracks, are so amazing, that they prove that the Genesis/Mega Drive can put out some of the best 16-bit music of all time.

If you haven't heard the music from those games, listen to them now! :D
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: This is my favorite Sega Genesis game hands down. I spent so much time playing each level experimenting with odd bullet builds and throwing people non-stop.
snippet.textOriginal: This is my favorite Sega Genesis game hands down. I spent so much time playing each level experimenting with odd bullet builds and throwing people non-stop.

snippet.textDisplay:
+Alex Batista "This is my favorite Sega Genesis game hands down."

Same here pretty much. Although I also do love Rocket Knight Adventures, Alien Soldier and Musha as much as I love Gunstar Heroes. :D

snippet.textDisplay: One of the best run & gun shooters and Genesis games ever. The gameplay is top notch and the colorful graphics are a joy to look at. What is Treasure up to now? They haven't released anything in a long while so I'm surprised they actually still exist.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the best run & gun shooters and Genesis games ever. The gameplay is top notch and the colorful graphics are a joy to look at. What is Treasure up to now? They haven't released anything in a long while so I'm surprised they actually still exist.

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky Haven't heard about them since Sin & Punishment 2 so I also had no idea what they're up to now, but I looked it up and they released two "Gaist Crusher" games on 3DS in 2013 and 2014 (japan only).
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky Haven't heard about them since Sin & Punishment 2 so I also had no idea what they're up to now, but I looked it up and they released two "Gaist Crusher" games on 3DS in 2013 and 2014 (japan only).

snippet.textDisplay: +SupraDarky Yeeeeah! I picked up this game for free on some Sega giveaway on Steam recently and suddenly realized it was a game I had played at a friends when I was quite young. I had all but forgotten it! Revisited it on Steam and it's actually really great and the gameplay holds up even today. The soundtrack is awesome as well.
snippet.textOriginal: +SupraDarky Yeeeeah! I picked up this game for free on some Sega giveaway on Steam recently and suddenly realized it was a game I had played at a friends when I was quite young. I had all but forgotten it! Revisited it on Steam and it's actually really great and the gameplay holds up even today. The soundtrack is awesome as well.

snippet.textDisplay: The 3ds version is a godsend. Double the health for a fair challenge, save whenever and gunslinger mode to switch between any gun combination on the fly. If only it had netplay for 2 players
snippet.textOriginal: The 3ds version is a godsend. Double the health for a fair challenge, save whenever and gunslinger mode to switch between any gun combination on the fly. If only it had netplay for 2 players
